The Browser present the class hierarchy, and also the relations between classes and Data properties.
The browser has the following elements:
The left part of the GUI presents a tree which shows the graph of Owl classes. It can also present the list of found by the tool if the corresponding option is selected
The right part of the GUI presents the graph of the Owl diagram, and a window presenting the annotations on the selected element on the tree
The bottom part of the GUI presents messages about the tool
Clicking on a Class on the left tree will center the diagram on the selected Class.
There are several menus in the browser:
"File": To open an Owl/RDF graph or save the selected graph as a graphML diagram (compatible with the free editor)
"Options": To set the
"Tools": Procides tools to use with the currently opened Schema. Currently it only contains a tool to execute SPARQL queries
"View": To change the layout of the selected graph
"Help": shows the version of the tool
The toolbar has the following buttons:
elements in the selected model
Zoom or Dezoom the selected graph
Center the selected graph
The File menu has the following elements:
Open Model: opening a Owl/RDF model
Export as GraphML: export the current Owl/RDF model as a GraphML diagramWhich can be opened in yEd
Open in yEd: open the current Owl/RDF model in
The tool does not handle Owl2 representations for the moment. If you try to open a Owl2 model, you will have the following error window:
The Options => Settings action allows to edit the configuration of the tool.
The Tools menu has the following elements:
Execute SPARQL: on the currently selected schema
Execute Script: on the currently selected schema
Debug Script: on the currently selected schema
The Tools => Layout action allows to change the layout of the current diagram.
After opening a diagram, a tab opens in the browser showing:
At the left the structure of the Owl model
At the right the diagram showing the model, and a window presenting the annotations on the selected element on the tree (see for more information)
The structure of the Owl model is separated in six tabs:
The Ontology tab, showing the metadata on the Ontology, and its namespaces and imported ontologies
The Annotations tab, showing the Annotations definitions
The Datatypes tab, showing the Datatypes definitions
The Classes tab, showing the Owl Classes
The Properties tab, showing the Object properties and the Data properties
The Individuals tab, showing the Individuals
The content window presents a diagram showing the model, and a window presenting the annotations on the selected element on the tree.
The Options => Settings action allows to edit the configuration of the tool.
Classes are presented with a Grey background
Individuals are presented with a Magenta background
Data properties are presented with a Cyan background
Classes from other are presented with an Orange background
